description: To the Editor:

title: Severance Finale Raises New Questions, but Were There Any Answers?
description: The second season of Severance just wrapped up with its longest episode yet. We have thoughts. Spoilers abound.

title: Five Free Movies to Stream Now
description: Parked underneath an overpass, a hit man looks out the window, surveying a bleak American landscape. The nation is, in a word, screwed. Theres a plague coming, Jackie (Brad Pitt) declares early on in Killing Them Softly.

title: The Novelty of a Natural Smile
description: I love your teeth. Youre from England, right? Charlotte Le Bon asks her co-star Aimee Lou Wood in an early episode of this season of The White Lotus.

title: Trump Cleaves Student Loan and Special Education Services From Education Dept.
description: President Trump announced Friday that the Education Department would no longer manage the nations $1.6 trillion student loan portfolio or supervise special needs programs in a major shake-up of an agency he has sought to eliminate.

title: In New Book, Barrett Says She Will Bring Readers Inside Supreme Court
description: Since her nomination to the Supreme Court, Justice Amy Coney Barrett has faced scrutiny from all sides.

title: Democratic Senators Ask Watchdogs to Investigate Musks Downsizing Efforts
description: Top Senate Democrats on Friday asked the internal watchdogs of more than a dozen government agencies to investigate job cuts carried out at the direction of Elon Musk and his Department of Government Efficiency operation.

title: Japanese Breakfasts Shimmering Sadness, and 8 More New Songs
description: Every Friday, pop critics for The New York Times weigh in on the weeks most notable new tracks. Listen to the Playlist on Spotify here (or find our profile: nytimes) and at Apple Music here, and sign up for The Amplifier, a twice-weekly guide to new and old songs.

title: Are We in a Constitutional Crisis?
description: Adam Liptak, who covers the Supreme Court for The New York Times, says the right question is not whether there is a constitutional crisis, but rather how much damage it will cause and how the American government may be fundamentally transformed.

title: Kilmer McCully, 91, Dies; Pathologist Vindicated on Heart Disease Theory
description: Kilmer S. McCully, a pathologist at Harvard Medical School in the 1960s and 70s whose colleagues banished him to the basement for insisting  correctly, it turned out  that homocysteine, an amino acid, was being overlooked as a possible risk factor for heart disease, died on Feb. 21 at his home in Winchester, Mass. He was 91.

title: As Trump Broadens Crackdown, Focus Expands to Legal Immigrants and Tourists
description: U.S. immigration agents wearing masks arrested a Georgetown University academic outside his home in Virginia. They detained two German tourists for weeks when they tried to enter the country legally through the southern border. They knocked on doors at Columbia University apartments, searching for pro-Palestinian protesters.

title: How Israel Divides the Right
description: For the first year after the attacks of Oct. 7, 2023, the most profound effect in America of Israels war in Gaza was to destabilize the Democratic Partys coalition. The reaction to the conflict widened an existing divide between pro-Israel Democratic Party elites and pro-Palestinian progressive activists and made unity seem impossible, leaving Kamala Harriss presidential campaign especially stuck straddling a chasm.

title: The Power of Two: An Anniversary Playlist
description: Surprise: Theres a birthday party in your inbox! Today were celebrating two years of The Amplifier, with  what else?  a themed playlist.

title: America Last: Why Shoppers Abroad Are Boycotting U.S. Goods
description: Bo Albertus, a school principal in Denmark, finds the Spanish raisins he now snacks on less tasty than his favorite Sun-Maid ones from California. There is no perfect substitute for Heinz tomato soup, a staple in his pantry. And he misses Pepsi Max.

title: A History of the Alien Enemies Act of 1798
description: The centuries-old wartime law invoked by President Trump to summarily deport Venezuelans accused of gang membership was contentious from the moment it was passed and has rarely been used in U.S. history.

title: Trump Rejects Idea That Musk Should Have Access to Top-Secret China War Plans
description: President Trump on Friday rejected the notion that the billionaire Elon Musk should be given access to top-secret U.S. plans for a potential military conflict with China, even as he denied a report that such a briefing had been planned to be held at the Pentagon.

title: ICE Tells a Cornell Student Activist to Turn Himself In
description: The Trump administration moved early Friday to detain an international student at Cornell University who has led protests on its Ithaca, N.Y., campus, in what appeared to be the latest effort to kick pro-Palestinian activists out of the United States.

title: Texas Measles Outbreak May Continue for a Year, Officials Say
description: As containment efforts falter, the measles outbreak in West Texas is likely to persist for a year, perhaps even setting back the countrys hard-fought victory over the virus, according to Texas health officials.

title: Robert Denham, Lawyer Who Steered Companies Through Crises, Dies at 79
description: Robert E. Denham, a mergers-and-acquisitions lawyer who was known for parachuting into imperiled companies and splintered board rooms and steering the organizations out of trouble, died on Saturday at his home in Pasadena, Calif. He was 79.

title: After Lunar Disappointments, NASA Hits the Jackpot With Blue Ghost
description: NASA made a bet a few years ago that commercial companies could take scientific experiments to the moon on a lower budget than the agency could.

title: Trump Shuts Down 3 Watchdog Agencies Overseeing Immigration Crackdown
description: The Trump administration shut down three watchdog agencies in the Department of Homeland Security on Friday, gutting the offices responsible for conducting oversight of President Trumps immigration crackdown.

title: Flashback: Your Weekly History Quiz, March 22, 2025
description: Can you sort 8 historical events?

title: Trump Attacks Reporting on Musk War Plans Meeting
description: President Trump claimed on Friday that a report in The New York Times, which detailed plans for Elon Musk to receive a briefing at the Pentagon on U.S. military plans for any prospective war with China, was made-up and fake.

title: Decades Ago, Columbia Refused to Pay Trump $400 Million
description: Donald Trump was demanding $400 million from Columbia University.

title: What Caused the Fire That Shut Down Heathrow Airport?
description: Investigators combed through the burned-out remains of a power substation near Londons Heathrow Airport on Friday, seeking the cause of a spectacular blaze that shuttered Europes busiest travel hub for much of a day and raised broader questions about Britains energy infrastructure.

title: Stranded by Heathrow Closure, Some Travelers Got Creative. Others Just Gave Up.
description: Phillip Kizun found himself having to improvise on Friday as he tried to get from London to Dublin, typically a routine trip.

title: Columbia Agrees to Trumps Demands After Federal Funds Are Stripped
description: Columbia University agreed on Friday to overhaul its protest policies, security practices and Middle Eastern studies department in a remarkable concession to the Trump administration, which has refused to consider restoring $400 million in federal funds without major changes.

title: Heathrow Rumbles Back to Life After Substation Fire Shut Down Airport
description: Heathrow Airport in London was plunged into chaos after a fire at an electrical substation shut down operations at one of Europes busiest air hubs, forcing the airport to cancel or divert more than 1,000 flights on Friday and removing a global linchpin of air travel.

title: I Need an Egg Donor. Can I Ask a Former Student?
description: Although Ive always wanted children, I didnt meet my husband until I was 40. I had frozen my eggs, but when I tried to use them, it didnt work out. After three years of trying and multiple I.V.F. attempts (fortunately covered by insurance), my doctors have said that, at 44, I wont be able to get pregnant with my own eggs. My husband and I have decided to pursue egg donation, which, unlike adoption, is covered by our insurance.

title: Bruce M. Selya, Federal Judge Known for Polysyllabic Prose, Dies at 90
description: Bruce M. Selya, a federal judge who issued more than 1,800 opinions and was celebrated (and occasionally chided) for a sesquipedalian writing style  that is, his use of long words that sent readers scrambling for a dictionary  died on Feb. 22 in Providence, R.I. He was 90.

title: Finding This Party Was Half the Fun
description: This fall, the ancient Central Asian city of Bukhara, which for centuries was a stop on the Silk Road  the 4,000-mile trade route along which goods and ideas spread across the continent  will once again become a vibrant hub of cultural exchange. For 10 weeks, starting on Sept. 5, the Uzbek city will host its first art biennial, an event that will bring together a mix of international artists  including the British sculptor Antony Gormley and the Colombian multidisciplinary artist Delcy Morelos  and Uzbek ones, such as the ceramics master Abdulvahid Bukhoriy Karimov, for site-specific exhibitions, workshops and feasts.

title: Where do the Candidates for New Jersey Governor Stand on the Issues?
description: The New York Times sent a wide-ranging survey to candidates for governor of New Jersey about housing, immigration, abortion, transit, affordability, schools and climate.

title: Trump Offers a Glimpse of New Stealth Fighter, the F-47
description: Since the late 1950s, most of Americas warplanes have been given names that indicate a threat, like the F-4 Phantom and the A-6 Intruder, or animals like the F-14 Tomcat, the F-15 Eagle and the F-16 Fighting Falcon.

title: Trump Administration Sees Bias in a Judge and Tries to Push Her Off a Case
description: The Trump administration filed a motion on Friday seeking to disqualify Judge Beryl A. Howell from presiding over a lawsuit brought by the law firm Perkins Coie over an executive order stripping its lawyers of their security clearances and denying them access to government buildings.

title: Trump Threatens to Jail Tesla Vandals in El Salvador Prisons
description: President Trump escalated his threats against people who vandalize Tesla cars, musing in a social media post on Friday that those convicted of damaging or destroying the vehicles  including U.S. citizens  could be sent to notorious prison complexes in El Salvador.

title: Columbia Concedes to Trump
description: In acquiescence to President Trump, Columbia University today agreed to overhaul its security and protest policies, and its Middle Eastern studies department.

title: Man Charged With Posing as Federal Agent After Promising Green Card Help
description: A New York City man posing as a law enforcement agent promised a woman that he could help her get a green card if she invested $500,000 with him, prosecutors said on Friday. Instead, the man kept the money and never submitted a visa application as he had promised.

title: Tate Brothers, Trailed by Human-Trafficking Charges, Are Returning to Romania
description: Andrew Tate and his brother, Tristan Tate, the online influencers who decamped last month to the United States while facing human-trafficking charges in two European countries, were set to return on Friday to Romania ahead of a criminal proceeding, one of them said Friday.

title: What to Know About Paul Weiss, the Law Firm Bowing to Trumps Demands
description: Paul Weiss, the New York law firm that this week struck a deal to escape President Trumps wrath, is one of the nations largest, with more than 1,000 lawyers representing some of the worlds wealthiest and most profitable companies.

title: An Interview With Elon Musks Daughter Was Months in the Making
description: Versha Sharma, the editor in chief of Teen Vogue, said she had started to pay close attention to Vivian Jenna Wilson, the 20-year-old daughter of Elon and Justine Musk, around the time of last falls presidential election.

title: Trump Administration Dropped Policy Prohibiting Contractors From Having Segregated Facilities
description: The Trump administration has removed a longstanding directive from the civil rights era that explicitly prohibited federal contractors from allowing segregated facilities, the latest move to eradicate diversity, equity and inclusion policies from government operations that has drawn fierce rebuke.

title: Why the Pentagon Scuttled Its Briefing of Musk on War Plans
description: Over the past 24 hours, my colleagues report that Elon Musk was set to be briefed on the militarys top-secret plans in the event of war with China has shaken Washington. It even seemed to take President Trump by surprise.

title: Paul Weiss Deal With Trump Faces Backlash From Legal Profession
description: Some lawyers said the deal was driven by profit. Others said it was enabling autocracy. One said the move had prompted her to quit her legal job in disgust.

title: Trump Administration Halts Funding for Legal Representation of Migrant Children
description: The Trump administration notified aid organizations across the country on Friday that it would cancel a contract that funds the legal representation of more than 25,000 children who entered the United States alone, a decision that leaves them vulnerable to swift deportation.

title: Social Security Leader Warns of Halt to Agencys Work, Before Backtracking
description: The acting commissioner of the Social Security Administration made a startling warning Friday that he might have to shut down the system that undergirds the agency, and then backtracked after a judge said he had misinterpreted a court order.

title: Police Recover Diamond Earrings Worth $769,500 That Thief Swallowed
description: Am I going to be charged with whats in my stomach? Jaythan Gilder asked a Florida jail employee on Feb. 26.

title: Corrections: March 23, 2025
description: An article on Page 8 this weekend about the actress Ellen Pompeo misstates the type of work that her husband, Chris Ivery, does. Ivery works in marketing; he is no longer a music producer.

title: Corrections: March 22, 2025
description: An article on Friday about beef tallow misstated the nature of a $1.5 million payment received by the American Heart Association. It was a donation from listeners of a radio program sponsored by Procter & Gamble, not a corporate sponsorship from Procter & Gamble itself.

title: How a Major Democratic Law Firm Ended Up Bowing to Trump
description: Since President Trumps first term, Brad S. Karp, the chairman of the law firm Paul, Weiss, Rifkind, Wharton & Garrison, championed himself as a bulwark against what he saw as an unlawful and unpredictable presidency.

title: Pop
description: SATURDAY PUZZLE  This grid is an exhilarating run around the track, isnt it? Its only Katie Hoodys third construction for The New York Times  her debut ran on a Saturday last year, and she followed up with a Thursday puzzle  but it has a number of traits that make it feel really polished, in my opinion.

title: George Foreman, Boxing Champion and Grilling Magnate, Dies at 76
description: George Foreman, a heavyweight boxing champion who returned to the sport to regain his title at the improbable age of 45, and parlayed his fame and amiable personality into a multimillion-dollar grill business, died on Friday night at a hospital in Houston. He was 76.

title: Trump Jumps Into a Major Wisconsin Court Race With an Endorsement
description: After weeks of appeals from Wisconsin Republicans, President Trump on Friday night endorsed Brad Schimel, the conservative candidate in a hard-fought contest that will decide control of the Wisconsin Supreme Court.

title: The Trump administration moved to end a program for migrants from 4 Caribbean and Latin American nations.
description: The Trump administration said Friday that it was ending a Biden-era program that allowed hundreds of thousands of people from four troubled countries to enter the United States lawfully and work for up to two years.

title: Trump Revokes Security Clearances for Biden, Harris, Clinton and More
description: President Trumps revenge tour continues.

title: Quote of the Day: 278 Unexpected Days on the Space Station Pays What, Now?
description: I would have done WAY better with mileage.

title: With Erdogan Rival Detained, Critics See Democracy Eroding in Turkey
description: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan entered this year facing a knot of political problems with little precedent in his two decades at the summit of power in Turkey.

title: The Snipers Nest
description: Four years ago, this was a prime riverside location in the capital of a nation that seemed to be inching toward democracy. Then came a military coup, and then almost two years of civil war, as the army and the Rapid Support Forces, its powerful paramilitary partner, turned on one another.

title: Travel Disruptions Linger as Flights Resume at Londons Heathrow
description: Heathrow Airport in London, one of the worlds busiest air hubs, resumed full operations on Saturday. But after a fire at an electrical substation halted operations for most of Friday, global travel remained disrupted.

title: Protests Swell in South Korea as Court Weighs Presidents Fate
description: Every day, thousands of protesters gather near South Koreas top court, which has fortified its walls with razor wire as its eight justices prepare a ruling that could shape the future of the countrys democracy. Many shout for the court to remove Yoon Suk Yeol, the countrys president, accusing him of insurrection. Nearby, a rival group chants for his reinstatement, calling his impeachment by Parliament fraudulent.

title: Spelling Bee Forum
description: Hi, busy bees! Welcome to todays Spelling Bee forum. Enter the comments section to see hints, conversation, helpful tips and creative content from other solvers.

title: How the Owner of a Nightclub and a Roller Rink Spends His Sundays
description: Varun Kataria wore many hats before he became a nightclub owner.

title: A Walkway Was Set to Open on the Queensboro Bridge. Until it Wasnt.
description: The plan was to transform two of New York Citys busiest crossings for cars into Bridges for the People, an idea that Bill de Blasio, the mayor at the time, said would help New Yorkers exit the era of fossil fuels.
